intro: Kohleria tetragona, commonly known as the four-angled kohleria, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family, which includes many ornamental and horticultural species. The plant is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors, including red, orange, and yellow. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth, waxy texture. Kohleria tetragona is often grown as a houseplant due to its attractive appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
